pullRequest.body:
- [x] depends on: #12068
- [x] depends on: leanprover/std4#730

This adds the necessary instances for types from Mathlib to play well with the new classes from Std. This solves one of the `mathlibSorry`'s from the [EmptyHexagon project](https://github.com/bsubercaseaux/EmptyHexagonLean/blob/98dee70a01acc111977bc8f9c369c59a922221d7/Lean/Geo/ToMathlib.lean#L217-L219).

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
This should be done for any `Lex _`.
There is `def lexOrd` in core. Should we reuse it here?

It doesn't have the right defeqs. I made a PR to core to fix it around the time I wrote this one, but if the usual pattern continues then it's probably still open... EDIT: apparently not! https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/pull/3882
dedent by 2 spaces?

I don't see why? Perhaps you are misreading, all the indents here appear necessary. (Although I could convert the first line to `where __ := Prod.Lex.partialOrder Î± Î²` and then the rest could come down by one indent level.)
Should we have a constructor from some *Ord typeclasses?
Probably, but it's not clear to me whether there is an exploitable pattern here.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `LawfulOrd` and `LinearOrder`
